Shadow Moth

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Shadow Moth

The Shadow Moth is a common creature found in many locations around the world. It is predatory and feeds on small mammals as well as occasionally dining on frogs and toads. Their enormous cocoons are often seen hanging in large bunches from trees, weighing them down significantly. Their larva stage is considered pestulant by many farmers who despise their insatiable apatite for seemingly all known crops.

Physical Traits:


  • Length: 45-65 cm


  • Wingspan: 110 to 145 cm


  • Weight: 700-2000 grams


  • Locomotion: Flight. Can also crawl slowly.


  • General Appearance: Shadow Moths come in a variety of colors depending on where you find them. Some of the most beautiful are the snow white Shadow Moths of the northern ice covered regions and are commonly referred to as "Snow Moths". They are gigantic in size and with the huge area their wings cover they tend to simply drift in the sky scanning for prey. A few have sharp circles dotting the wings but most tend to be a light blend of a narrow range of colors, however in all varieties, they are characterized by a near black coloring to the underside of the wings which is where their name comes from. During night flight they are all but invisible.


  • Concept:
